hints_html: How can we write the volume of a parallelepiped formed by three vectors in terms of a determinant?
hints_latex:
How can we write the volume of a parallelepiped formed by three vectors
in terms of a determinant?
hints_raw: How can we write the volume of a parallelepiped formed by three vectors in terms of a determinant?
question: 1 (e)
sols_html:
The parallelepiped formed by the vectors \(AB\), \(AC\) and \(AP\) is given by (the absolute value of) the determinant of the three vectors. From 1(a) and 1(c), we have that

\[\begin{aligned} \vec{AB}&=[-2,2,1]\\ \vec{AC}&=[-1,1,1]\end{aligned}\]

and so all we need is \(\vec{AP}\),

\[\begin{aligned} \vec{AP}=P-A=[0,-1,0].\end{aligned}\]

Therefore, the volume of the parallelepiped is given by

\[\begin{aligned} \textrm{volume}&=\left|\textrm{det} \begin{pmatrix} -2 & 2 & 1\\ -1 & 1 & 1\\ 0 & -1 & 0 \end{pmatrix}\right|\\ &=\left|-1\textrm{det} \begin{pmatrix} -2 & 1\\ -1 & 1 \end{pmatrix}\right|\\ &=|-2+1|=|-1|=1.\end{aligned}\]
sols_raw:
The parallelepiped formed by the vectors <math>AB</math>, <math>AC</math> and <math>AP</math> is given by (the absolute value of) the determinant of the three vectors.  From [[Science:Math_Exam_Resources/Courses/MATH152/April_2012/Question_1_(a)|1(a)]] and [[Science:Math_Exam_Resources/Courses/MATH152/April_2012/Question_1_(c)|1(c)]], we have that

:<math>
\begin{align}
\vec{AB}&=[-2,2,1]\\
\vec{AC}&=[-1,1,1]
\end{align}
</math>

and so all we need is <math>\vec{AP}</math>,

:<math>
\vec{AP}=P-A=[0,-1,0].
</math>

Therefore, the volume of the parallelepiped is given by

:<math>
\begin{align}
\textrm{volume}&=\left|\textrm{det}
\begin{pmatrix}
-2  &  2  &  1\\
-1  &  1  &  1\\
0  &  -1  &  0
\end{pmatrix}\right|\\
&=\left|-1\textrm{det}
\begin{pmatrix}
-2  &  1\\
-1  &  1
\end{pmatrix}\right|\\
&=|-2+1|=|-1|=1.
\end{align}
</math>
statement_html:
Let \(S_1\) be the plane perpendicular to \(\mathbf{n}=[2,1,-1]\) and through the point P=[1,-1,0]. Let \(S_2\) be the plane through the points A=[1,0,0], B=[-1,2,1], C=[0,1,1]. By L, we denote the line of intersection of \(S_1\) and \(S_2\).

Calculate the volume of the parallelpiped with edges AB, AC, and AP.
